node.title: Is Bellerive really on the nose? It's just not cricket
node.alt: A sports stadium as seen from the sky.
node.description: With Hobart now forced into a race to secure the fifth Ashes Test against mainland rivals, Chris Rowbottom asks why it wasn't awarded outright — is the game in such brittle condition that playing one Ashes test in Tasmania will see it crumble?
node.content:
["Make history, not money.\u00a0", "That's Tasmanian premier Peter Gutwein's sales pitch to Cricket Australia, which on Tuesday revealed\u00a0it'd be putting the fifth\u00a0Ashes test out to tender rather than awarding it directly to Hobart, Melbourne, or any city other than Perth.\u00a0", "Instead, it'll force Tasmania into a dogfight with not only four other states which wish to host the lucrative fixture, but also the ACT and whichever other city or regional venue wishes to put its hand up for hosting rights.\u00a0", "Suddenly, Tasmania, which was previously quietly confident at securing the vacant Test, is in a free-for-all with its four\u00a0big brothers, armed with only a hope and a prayer.", "Cricket Australia has laid out a number of criteria that bidders must meet\u00a0\u2014\u00a0among them, \"commercial considerations\".", "", "
Perth last hosted an Ashes Test in 2017 but COVID has dashed hopes for a return in this series.(AAP: Dave Hunt)
", "In other words, as well as being COVID-safe and having working lights, the successful bidder should be able to fill Cricket Australia's pockets and fill them well, through ticket sales and TV eyeballs. \u00a0", "If not, their chances of seeing Test cricket (for four\u00a0states, for a second time) up close will diminish.\u00a0", "It's Test cricket officially for sale\u00a0to the highest bidder: a worrying precedent, even in the brave new world of a pandemic.\u00a0", "How, under these criteria, can Tasmania possibly hope to compete with Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland when it comes to revenue-raising?", "At Cricket Australia, all states are supposed to be equal. It's why there are six\u00a0member associations, each with a delegated director sitting on the board.\u00a0", "But an expression-of-interest process that lists commercial considerations as a criterion casts a disturbing shadow of inequality across the entire landscape.\u00a0", "As former Hobart Hurricane and Melbourne Star Ben Dunk recently surmised on Twitter: \"Why not play all 5 at the MCG if it's only money that matters?\"", "To answer Dunk's question:\u00a0because that's not what the federated model, which in Cricket Australia's own words \"works in the national interest of Australian cricket\" is about.\u00a0", "That Cricket Australia would even consider doubling up at an existing test venue rather than award an Ashes test to Bellerive Oval, which hasn't hosted test cricket since 2016,\u00a0is perplexing.\u00a0", "Will Australian cricket fall over if the fifth Test isn't played at the biggest venue in the most populous state? Is the game in such brittle condition\u00a0that playing one Ashes test in Tasmania will see it crumble?", "The tender process shows Cricket Australia has a willingness to shove five\u00a0tests into four venues, when there is a completely viable fifth\u00a0venue available. \u00a0", "
Is Bellerive Oval really that on the nose?
", "It shouldn't be.", "Last year, Tasmania was deemed good enough to stage a three-week-long Big Bash League hub, as other states lived under the cloud of COVID, allowing\u00a0Cricket Australia's biggest money-spinner to get underway.\u00a0", "The start of this year's WBBL competition was also shifted to Tasmania under similar circumstances with other states out of action.\u00a0", "When Cricket Australia called, Tasmania answered.\u00a0", "", "
Australia's Pat Cummins and England's Joe Root get their hands on the spoils at the Gabba this week.(AAP: Jono Searle)
", "Where might Cricket Australia's finances be, had Tasmania not come to its rescue on those occasions?", "Each contender is now racing to pitch their plan as the best, but Peter Gutwein was the fastest out of the gate\u00a0plucking at Cricket Australia's heart strings rather than its purse strings.", "\"My message is, don't be seduced by the bigger states, this is more than the bottom line, this is your chance to make history,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Peter Gutwein is keen to welcome the Barmy Army to Tasmanian shores.\u00a0(AAP/Darren England)
", "Even with its one red ball offering \u2014\u00a0a one-off test against Afghanistan \u2014\u00a0cancelled, Tasmania must still scratch\u00a0and scrape.\u00a0", "It's true that Cricket Australia must maximise its economic return when making such decisions, for the good of the broader game.\u00a0", "If only that financial caution was applied to its broadcast deal with Sony in India, which it miscalculated by $40 million resulting in a shortfall that, according to The Australian in October, is expected to be made up by returning Ashes crowds.\u00a0", "Tasmanian cricket fans, heading into their longest-ever stretch without a Test match since Bellerive hosted its first in 1989, will hope they aren't the ones that pay for Cricket Australia's broadcast bungle.\u00a0", "
'Robbing Perth to pay Paul' not necessary
", "", "
The second Test between Australia and South Africa in 2016 was the last Test played at Bellerive.(ABC News: Jon Healy)
", "Cynics will point to poor attendances at the previous two Hobart tests \u2014\u00a0a rain-affected drubbing of the West Indies which started in November, and a belting at the hands of South Africa which was all over early on the second last day.", "Neither is a good case study.\u00a0", "In 2013, the England and Wales Cricket Board awarded an Ashes test to Durham, in the country's\u00a0north-east in what was to be the first Ashes test match played at The Riverside since it was awarded first-class status in 1992.\u00a0", "The impact the historic test had on the working class region was profound, and surely not to be forgotten any time soon. \u00a0", "Cricket Australia could easily do the same for Tasmania, and it wouldn't even be robbing Perth to pay Paul. \u00a0", "It's the least it could do for the state which has been largely ignored on the international stage for half a decade.\u00a0"]
